questions.text: _____ maintains consistency among data flow diagrams (DFDs) by ensuring that input and output data flows align properly.
questions.explanation: Balancing ensures consistency between levels of DFDs by matching input and output data flows across diagrams.

questions.text: Decision trees show the logic structure in a _____.
options: vertical form that resembles a tree with the roots at the bottom and the branches at the top
horizontal form that resembles a tree with the roots at the left and the branches to the right
vertical form that resembles a tree with the roots at the top and the branches at the bottom
horizontal form that resembles a tree with the roots at the right and the branches to the left
questions.correctAnswer: horizontal form that resembles a tree with the roots at the left and the branches to the right
questions.explanation: Decision trees use a left-to-right horizontal structure to represent conditions and resulting actions logically.

questions.text: In a data dictionary, _____ is the maximum number of characters for an alphabetic or character data element or the maximum number of digits and number of decimal positions for a numeric data element.
questions.explanation: Length specifies the maximum size of a data element, defining character or numeric limits.

questions.text: A _____ documents the details of a functional primitive, which represents a specific set of processing steps and business logic.
questions.explanation: A process description provides detailed documentation of how a functional primitive operates.

questions.text: In addition to the Gane and Sarson symbol set, another popular symbol set is _____.
questions.explanation: The Yourdon symbol set is widely used for creating DFDs and other structured analysis diagrams.

questions.text: A _____ shows a logical structure, with all possible combinations of conditions and resulting actions.
questions.explanation: Decision tables display conditions and outcomes to simplify complex logical relationships.

questions.text: Using _____, an analyst starts with an overall view, which is a context diagram with a single process symbol, and then the analyst creates diagram 0, which shows more detail.
questions.explanation: Exploding involves breaking down high-level DFD processes into more detailed sub-processes.

questions.text: Which one of the following is a typical example of a system requirement for the performance category?
options: The purchasing system must provide suppliers with up-to-date specifications.
Each input form must include date, time, product code, customer number, and quantity.
The manager of the sales department must approve orders that exceed a customer's credit limit.
The student records system must produce class lists within five hours after the end of registration.
questions.correctAnswer: The student records system must produce class lists within five hours after the end of registration.
questions.explanation: Performance requirements specify time-related outputs or system responsiveness.

questions.text: To evaluate _____, a systems analyst needs information about projected future volume for all outputs, inputs, and processes.
questions.explanation: Scalability assesses whether the system can handle growth in volume or workload in the future.

questions.text: A(n) _____ uses various symbols and shapes to represent data flow, processing, and storage.
questions.explanation: A DFD illustrates how data moves through a system, showing processes, data stores, and flows.

questions.text: A(n) _____ investigates, analyses, designs, develops, installs, evaluates, and maintains a company's information systems.
questions.explanation: A systems analyst is responsible for analysing business needs and designing effective information systems.

questions.text: The systems requirements documents include all the following except _____.
questions.explanation: System requirements documents describe functional, technical, and user needs—not actual database content.

questions.text: Transaction processing (TP) systems _____.
options: provide job-related information to users at all levels of a company
simulate human reasoning by combining a knowledge base and inference rules
process data generated by day-to-day business operations
include email, voice mail, fax, video conferencing, and other office tools
questions.correctAnswer: process data generated by day-to-day business operations
questions.explanation: TP systems handle routine transactions such as sales, payroll, and inventory updates.

questions.text: In a(n) _____, team members prepare to lunge at each other to achieve their objectives.
questions.explanation: In Agile methodology, a scrum is a short, focused meeting used to coordinate and achieve goals quickly.

questions.text: The term _____ refers to a system's ability to handle increased business volume and transactions in the future.
questions.explanation: Scalability ensures a system can expand to meet future performance and capacity demands.

questions.text: Of the measures of feasibility, questions such as: 'Does the proposed platform have sufficient capacity for future needs?' and 'Will the hardware and software environment be reliable?' should be considered while assessing _____.
questions.explanation: Technical feasibility evaluates whether existing technology can support the proposed system.

questions.text: A common tool for showing the distribution of a questionnaire or sampling results is a vertical bar chart called a _____.
questions.explanation: A histogram graphically represents data distribution across categories using vertical bars.

questions.text: In the rapid application development (RAD) model, the _____ phase focuses on program and application development tasks similar to the SDLC.
questions.explanation: The construction phase in RAD involves actual development of the system’s components.

questions.text: Which of the following is a typical example of a system requirement for the control category?
options: The customer analysis system must produce a quarterly report identifying changes in ordering patterns.
The system must maintain separate levels of security for users and the system administrator.
The data entry screens must be uniform, except for background color, which can be changed by the user.
The warehouse distribution system must analyze daily orders and create routing patterns for delivery trucks.
questions.correctAnswer: The system must maintain separate levels of security for users and the system administrator.
questions.explanation: Control requirements define security, access, and authorisation rules within the system.

questions.text: Which of the following is a typical example of a system requirement for the process category?
options: The website must report online volume statistics every four hours and hourly during peak periods.
The system must be operated seven days a week, 365 days a year.
The equipment rental system must not execute new rental transactions for customers who have overdue accounts.
All transactions must have audit trails.
questions.correctAnswer: The equipment rental system must not execute new rental transactions for customers who have overdue accounts.
questions.explanation: Process requirements specify how system tasks should be executed under defined conditions.

questions.text: _____ is a fact-finding technique that can help a systems analyst understand how the current system is supposed to work.
questions.explanation: Document review helps analysts study existing system records to understand operations and processes.

questions.text: Supporters of neutral locations for interviews believe that it _____.
options: makes the interviewee feel comfortable during the meeting
gives the interviewee easy access to supporting material that might be needed
keeps interruptions to a minimum so that people can concentrate fully
gives the interviewee an opportunity to take calls during the interview
questions.correctAnswer: makes the interviewee feel comfortable during the meeting
questions.explanation: Neutral locations reduce perceived hierarchy and make the interviewee more relaxed and open.

questions.text: The data dictionary usually records and describes a default value, which is the _____.
options: the set of values permitted for the data element
identification of the user(s) responsible for changing values for the data element
specification for the origination point for the data element's value
value for the data element if a value is not entered for it
questions.correctAnswer: value for the data element if a value is not entered for it
questions.explanation: A default value automatically applies when no explicit data value is entered.
